reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was very good ($65 without tax; $74 with tax) with free parking (we've never had any problems in parking there). However, the room was a disappointment. The black chair was stained all over; it'd be better that the room din't have any chair, than to have one like that...
reviews.title: You get what you paid for...

reviews.text: The floor in the shower stall was cracked as you can see in the photos -> room 220) and the towels were very thin. TV was OK, although I don't remember if it had many channels or not; didn't see it too much, anyway. The bed was comfortable enough. The sink area was also fine with granite stone. We would hear some street noise (both nights) and people talking loud (in one night).
reviews.title: Good Location, Terrible Room

reviews.text: In the reception the staff was quite indifferent, but check-in and chek-out was fast. Complimentary breakfast was also OK (there was toasts, yogurt, eggs (boiled and scrambled, waffles, juices, milk, coffee).
reviews.title: Great stay - good location.

reviews.text: Next time I prefer to pay more and have a more decent room!
reviews.title: Rundown

reviews.text: I stayed here while attending a conference hosted at the nearby convention center. Walking there was simple and easy, and the location of the hotel was clearly the primary benefit for staying in this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a 2 week road trip around California and got a really good deal on this Sacramento hotel. It was the cheapest hotel on our trip, but had the widest choice at the buffet breakfast. It was the only hotel with some hot food options (sausages and scrambled eggs) in addtion to cereals, toast, boiled eggs, waffles, danish pastries, muffins,crumpets, yoghurt, fruit, juice & coffee/tea.
reviews.title: Great value
Adequate Room, Friendly Staff, Will Return
reviews.text: The hotel is looking a little tired (our room had some peeling wallpaper), but nothing too horrendous. Our room was very clean and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful.

There is a good choice of restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel is well located for the sights. We walked to the Capitol building (about 15 minutes walk) and walked on to Old Sacramento from there.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was in a quiet location, but we arrived on a Friday night and I'm not sure if this is a popular location for hen/stag nights, but we did see a hen party, and we were woken up at 2.00am in the morning by a loud drunken group. Not sure how often this happens, but the hotel did seem fairly quiet apart from this.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights June 3rd - 6th, Room 209. There is a security gate on each floor so only guests can enter the floor level - I liked that extra security. The Breakfast was also a bonus. Our room had only a shower, but other family members travelling with us stayed in room 211 which had a bathtub. I also noticed a suite above the office if you need a bigger room. They have an outdoor pool which I didn't use but my family did - the kids seemed to enjoy that although it was very cold. Parking was tight but there were alot of oversized vehicles taking up room. Its not the Hyatt so don't expect 5 star and its an older building, patched walls here and there, but pretty decent for a midscale motel. It was clean and comfortable and a Great location with a good price. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Pretty Decent
Worse Hotel Experience
reviews.text: First, there was water backed up in the tub/shower, and the toilet was stopped dup. We were tired and hungry after a 12-hour drive, so we skipped the shower and went to dinner. Upon returning, we discovered that our 2nd floor room backed to a dance club, with the speakers obviously on the opposite side of the wall. They said they could not move us, and that it was beyond their control, but not to worry, the music would stop when the club closed at 3am! To top things off, there was now no running water in the bathroom(or anywhere in the hotel).

reviews.title: Terrible Experience
reviews.text: Frustrated, I called the Canadian Comfort Inn/Suites number and complained about the obvious, and added the loud rattle in the A/C and the TV that had to be unplugged to power off. Soon a man arrived, swearing heavily in English, but with a French accent. Apparently, he was the only facilities guy working that night and there were multiple complaints that evening. He explains that he can't do anything about the music, he decided to unclog the bath, but with no running water, it brought a strong raw sewage stench into the room! Then he unplugs the TV to turn it off, then kicks the A/C a couple times to stop the rattle (which quickly returned). Remember, we had just driven 12 hours, and we got no sleep until 3am. If we got 3 hours of sleep, we were lucky. We did manage to take showers in the morning.

reviews.title: Quality Inn Downtown .. nice surprise
reviews.text: After reading the reviews about this hotel I was a bit concerned about what I might find when I arrived. Just to avoid any confusion this is the Quality Inn on Crescent St. Well , here is my take... The reception was excellent, I arrived about 10 am as I had taken a red eye flight from SFO. They had been full the night before but they had a housekeeper work on a room that had just checked out and I was in my room in less than one hour.

reviews.title: Very Pleased
reviews.text: This after enjoying a nice breakfast in the hotels intimate and amazingly inexpensive restaurant. The food was good but I finally found a place in Montreal where you can find bad coffee.

reviews.title: APPAULING SERVICE
reviews.text: The room itself was quite spacious and immaculately clean. High speed internet is CA$9.95 per stay. There are many CATV channels as well as pay per view. The real joy of the rooms here are the walkout balconies with nice views of downtown and the soundproofing is very good. The hotel hallways were looking a bit shabby mainly because they had installed new door frames on the stairwell doors, but for some reason hadn't painted them. Oh, and watch your step when going into or out of the bathroom !

reviews.title: My stay at the (Lack of) Quality Inn Downtown.
reviews.text: On the night before my check out I called for a wake up call at 1030 am to accomodate their 12n checkout policy. The receptionist asked what time my flight was and I told her 4pm... she then asked if I wanted to Check out at 2pm? , and would I like a taxi waiting ? ! Wow.. That's service !

reviews.title: I think things have improved here...
reviews.text: I found this hotel to be perfect for what we were looking for. I was travelling with a University Woman's Basketball Team and we had to play 4 games in 3 days. We also wanted to see a bit of Montreal. This hotel was close to the downtown shopping experience and was close to the gyms we were playing in. The rooms were very nice and the service was excellant. Parking (paid) was across the street and very accessible. All in all, we had a great stay, two great sleeps and a great experience. When we go back next year, this is where we will stay.

The Quality Inn is probably the most convenient budget hotel to the convention center. It's about a block away. But there is a night club on 15th that goes until 2:00 am and is very loud when everyone gets out at 2:00. It's also close to a fire station and I heard several police cars going by.
reviews.title: Close to the convention center but very loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides that, I found the room to be clean and functional. The continental breakfast was good, and the person at the front desk (Frances) was friendly and helpful. Except for the noise, if I were to be going to another convention in Sacramento I would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: Decent Room for Price

likes.liked: — Clean room, comfortable bed and pillow.
likes.disliked: — We stayed on a Sat. nite, loud until around 2a.m. due mostly to foot traffic on nearby sidewalk. Not unbearable, but wouldn't recommend to early to bed types.

reviews.text: Not a bad place to stay. This isn't a luxury inn or anything, but the room was clean and had everything we needed for a one night stay after a night out watching a friend perform downtown. The continental breakfast was worth the trip down to the office; everything was fresh, with plenty of options. The front desk staff the night we checked in and the morning after was very nice.
reviews.title: Good value budget option

reviews.text: This is a decent but no-frills in downtown Sacramento. OK, it's not the most appealing of places to stay - it's in the shadow of a 8-story parking garage. But it's good value for where it is (a lot of the other 'downtown' Sacramento motels are actually a shuttle ride away). I paid $51 including tax.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

likes.disliked: — Desk staff could use some training on courtesy

reviews.text: The room was fine and very clean. The staff were friendly - they didn't let me check in early, but it was fine to leave the car and a bag there during the day. Not a lot of ambience, but what do you expect for the price?
reviews.title: Yikes! Won't stay again

reviews.text: Quality Inn, Sacramento
reviews.title: Get What You Pay For!

reviews.text: This Inn is pretty good in terms of price. I saw this hotel as the best low price in Sacramento. However, you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Good value budget stay in Downtown

reviews.text: I had to get to this hotel in a last minute trip. They were very accommodating and got me a room on the third floor. There is an interesting security precaution of walking up the stairs to the gate that guards the second and third floors and you put in your room key into the slot to unlock. Clever.
reviews.title: Good value & location for the budget traveler.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I got was clean and presentable, nice Queen bed that was not too hard or soft. Good heater for the cold winter Sacramento nights. However, the shower ran pretty much hot and cold when it wanted to. Even with the fine finesse of the shower head and faucet, it was nearly impossible not to freeze or burn. I took a very short shower!
reviews.title: It ain't pretty, but . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day I got a new room because I found I needed to stay one more night. This time I got a room on the second floor. Beware that the office people lock their door at night so you have to get their attention and knock on the door for them to open up. Not sure why. The neighborhood looked safe to me.
reviews.title: Value for the money in Downtown Sac
